title: Discharge
body: Surgeons are amazing, care is fabulous but waiting 7+ hours for discharge what a joke. No wonder they think there’s a bed shortage.

readBy.name: Frimley Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Time to speak with the nurse to help become more relaxed before the health check. Made me feel good about the positive aspects and see a way forward to help in other areas of I proving my health.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Fantastic Practice
body: The nurse was fantastic and she made us feel comfortable, would definately recommend this walk in centre anytimne. Very friendly service

title: Really good doctors and nurses also telephone…
body: I have had a very good experience with this medical centre from my 1st call on 24/1/2020 till I saw the nurse today very helpful on phones and doctor explained the problem

title: Worst practice ever
body: Never answer phone u can call at 8 n it will just go of or busy tone constantly, reception staff are so rude, they ask what is your problem, it’s none of there businesses and when u say it’s private they say well u need to tell us, no I do not and that’s the law I do not wish to discuss something personal with reception staff. They make you use a app to place your medication order so why has every other surgery in the UK have the option to book appointments but this 1 doesn’t, ppl work and have to try and get children ready for school at 8am why not have them appointments live on app. Also you never get to see your own doctor it’s always students or new doctors what happened to are good old edge hill centre. And before you request I call to speak to manager I can just about get threw for a appointment

title: Wonderful nurse, sadly left.
body: My wonderful nurse was the best thing to ever of happened to that place. She is such a caring character and cared so much for me and my family. Such a terrible shame she’s left this practice and extremely shocked and appalled to hear why. I certainly will be following her to new practice and I know many others will.

title: Amazing treatment
body: Although I am younger than the norm that visit the FAU .. I was referred to the team by my GP today.. I cannot praise enough each and every one of the staff in the department.. they were thorough with all the tests and examinations they did.. they were friendly and made me feel at ease from  the start...and they listened to me and this is what you need when things have been a struggle physically as they have been for me.. I have left the hospital feeling more confident than I have in a long time that they will find the cause of the pain I am experiencing... I am returning to the department on Monday to continue the tests to achieve this..so the short waiting time is such a blessing as well.. so I just want to say thank you and in a perfect world we would all benefit from receiving care of this standard.

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellent and speedy care
body: An accident meant I needed to visit Tiverton hospital. With the NHS under fire in the media for waiting times, I can only praise the speedy treatment I received from the receptionist, triage nurse and GP

title: Hand Hygiene
body: Today 31st Jan 2020 I had to bring in my father to see the GP, this was perfectly ok, however knowing that this is the time of year for viruses to spread I went to 4 hand bacterial bottles on the walls and none of them had any bacterial cleansing liquid in them which is very poor considering all the notices around the waiting room for Flu.

title: Great Service
body: I had my first MRI scan here and everything about it was professional and friendly. Everything was explained to me, the radiologist spoke to me via the headphones, the nurse was reassuring and friendly. I had not heard of this establishment but was referred there instead of the usual RBH in Reading. I would certainly request here if I should need further scans or indeed anything else. The whole place was very calm and the coffee shop was very welcoming. Thank you

readBy.name: Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust

title: Helpful Receptionist
body: I would like to thank the receptionist for the pleasant and professional  manner she showed me when I booked an appointment for a blood test. I am usually left disappointed when I have tried before. Thank you.

title: Good practice
body: Good and clean surgery with helpful and friendly staff. It’s great to see the same GP when needed. Overall I am very happy and would recommend to people in my area.

title: Great staff
body:
The nurse was very friendly and professional. Was very thorough and patient whilst doing spirometry test with my son.
Always found all the staff great.

title: Fantastic Hospital “Great Care”
body:
I was first operated on 10/2018- left knee replacement. Then again 12/2019 right knee replacement. 
I can say that the expert care and individual attention I was given was impeccable. I would like to thank all staff and the surgeons who afforded me great care and warmth during both of my stays in hospital. You are treated as an individual and all staff have your needs at heart at all times from admission to discharge.  
I would like to thank them for their dedication and expertise in looking after me and giving me my life back and getting me mobile again. 

I thank you all from the bottom of my heart. Excellent care!!!!!

Very helpful and obliging reception staff, rang @ 9am duty dr rang back 9.30am appointment booked same day. Lovely kind and understanding female dr. Diagnosis straight away.  Happy with outcome. Dr wasn’t running on time, Not the end of the world. For a busy GP practice great all round service.

title: All good :)
body:
Seen shortly before appointment time.
The dermatologist was very approachable, professional and reassuring, very clear on further treatment and timings. Worked as a team with other colleague. All good , thanks :)

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Lovely endoscopy team!
body: Just want to say a huge thankyou to all the lovely team on the endoscopy unit. I arrived yesterday 30/01/20 to be told that my endoscopy couldn't take place due to the endoscopist going home poorly. I was clearly distressed as having to rebook and repeat the bowel prep petrified me! The lovely staff worked hard to get me an appointment at another unit and managed to get me a slot in bicester for the same day. I had my endoscopy done in bicester and I'm so grateful for all their effort in helping me. I was very upset at the time and probably didnt come across as very grateful. Please thank the matron and all the team for being so lovely to me!

readBy.name: Gloucestershire Care Services NHS Trust

title: Fantastic staff
body:
My child was rushed into surgery tonight and the staff were amazing. They put her mind at rest and made her feel more at ease.
They went out of their way to help with everything.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Perfect service
body: In just two weeks I have received two perfect minor surgery’s. I was made completely calm, with a complete understanding of what was going to happen. It was carried out brilliantly with a superb aftercare service. This has improved my well being and I can now confidently socialise again without thinking people are more focused on my imperfections than my conversation. It is a life changing service that couldn’t be performed any better.

title: My Health  event
body: I was invited by Carepoint Practice  to  a very successful My Health event on 9th January organised by Carepoint and their Patients Participation Group.The event was well supported by patients who attended the workshops concerning their health and  also special workshops on diabetes. The various NHS Community and Social organisations who  were in attendance on the day  proved extremely popular. Congratulations to Carepoint for organising such a pioneering event.

title: Poor communication
body: I was taken in for an assessment and then just left to wait for hours with no communication. When we asked one of the nurses if they had any idea how long we’d be waiting they were very rude and dismissive. I was in a lot of pain so this was not welcomed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Urgent care
body: I arrived with my daughter at 21:30 in A&E unit and the doctor saw her at 01:30..He didn’t even care about her..he actually opened another patient’s file first.He wrote a prescription without cheking my daughter ..Very rude and sarcastic..

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Excellent service and always able to get an…
body: Myself and my family have been at this practice for over 20 years and I have never had difficulty getting an appointment as long as procedure is followed , the online system is a great asset. Reception Staff are Helpful , nurses and healthcare assistants are excellent at their jobs and although I have a preference to which GP I see , would see either if it was urgently needed , they are also efficient at reminding me to book in for regular screenings ie health checks etc . I have to deal with lots of GP surgery’s within my role and would give this one 5 stars over everyone of the others in surrounding areas .

title: Patient care
body:
I went for a scheduled appointment to see a doctor from gynecology. I felt that I wasn't heard or cut off mid sentence when trying to explain my circumstance. The doctor was very abrupt and left me feeling more confused when I left. The doctor's actions made me feel as if I was wasting his time.
 I was referred  to the gynecology outpatient ward for a reason and shouldn't be made to feel this way especially from a professional who's suppose to help. It's understandable that yes he does have a lot a patient's as he proceeded tell me that he has a "long long waiting list" and he deals with "complex cases" so he will refer me to another surgeon. But I do feel that every patient should feel valued and not like a burden.

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely appalling!!!
body:
Receptionist was visibly unclean hair was very greasy and was not a nice odour. Nurse who did pre-op was complaining about cost of dental treatment. 
When I wasn’t able to go ahead with procedure I was laughed at by the nurse assisting. 
The nurses in the discharge area had to take my vitals several times because they kept walking away when starting the BP monitor to deal with other issues by this I mean discussing what break they where going on and what they had brought for lunch. 
When I tried to rebook for another time I was told there where no appointments 
Then after already being thoroughly annoyed I was informed I couldn’t have anything to eat for drink for another hour I said fine and they insisted on writing it down for me like I was incapable of acknowledging or understanding the instruction. 
All in all pretty poor. 
I work with the general public in a health setting and I would hate to make a single one of my patients feel as badly as they made me feel. 
I only hope that this is not the future of the health services otherwise we are all in a lot of trouble. 
Approach with caution everyone!!

title: Awful
body: Called at 21.30 for my 80 year old fathers knee replacement seizing up, and in lots of pain. 8 hrs later got a call saying I have to take him to a&e. Now just got wrestle an elderly man into a car with only one working knee at 6 am with the condescending tone of a doctor ringing in my ear.

title: Brilliant Home
body:
This home is very welcoming and extremely well run and all the staff are very kind and helpful and the home is always clean and organised. 
Our daughter has been here for 5 
years and she is very happy here and her care has been consistently of a high standard. 
We are kept informed of any changes and have regular reviews and contribute to her care with our views being considered. 
My daughter enjoys all the varied activities that are provided including the on site facilities including a sensory room and hydro pool along with an art and pottery room.  
What is also great is that she has opportunity to go on holiday in a small group every year.  We are very happy that she happy and we can visit when we like.

title: Fantastic
body: Thank you to everyone who looked after me yesterday, I was a day patient and was made to feel at ease from the moment I walked in, everyone extremely friendly and caring.

title: gp crisis line basildon - poor at best
body:
I was in crisis.  My GP arranged for a call from this,team.
The women who phoned me to asses me was confrontational, unhelpful and did nothing to support me or my needs.
She told me she didn't think I was for them. I did not need inpatient care with the mental health team. (which I suppose was positive but didn't sem like it from the way it was delivered).
If I felt unwell I should attend a and e.
In crisis - v helpful.  I felt bereft after the call.  I didn't follow through. Disappointing.

title: Poor Data Management & PALS
body: My wife attended A&E in mid September 2019 requiring follow-up appointments at West Middlsx Hospital during November & December 2019. On 6th November 2019 she completed & hand submitted a Personal Medical Records request to the Document Management office. Despite numerous attempts to chase - visits & telephone calls, including requests for assistance from PALS - she has heard nothing and received no information, nearly 3 montha later.

title: The C.B.U. is truly an amazing place
body:
Detoxed at the CBU for nearly 3 weeks this year, it was my first residential detox and I struggled all the way through it but all the staff were so supportive and fantastic, would not be drug free now without them. I would like to wholeheartedly thank you for saving my life. The unit is completely patient focused and a world apart from “One flew over the cuckoos nest and The Shining!”
Thank you all once again. 
Mark McAsey 
(Hope two other people are ok with whom I shared the CBU experience with, top fellas)

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor in general
body:
I attended in December, it's now the 1st of February and no results.
Tried calling nobody answers and they only appear to have a results line not an actual phone number that is there even though iv seen reception answer the phone outside of the phone hours.
You have a clinic on a Saturday but no phone service on a Saturday? How do you expect people to call and ask if they need assistance as advised on your website? Iv booked an appointment today for today(just to go an get my results) what if I needed special assistance

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Go buy food or starve
body:
Let me break down my situation so i can try convincing you how bad the food is here and how i had to make myself get even more sick before getting better.
I came in with sickcell pain to lower back and legs it hurt to walk. 
And i had the flu. High temperaturess was bedridden.
I came in a&e no phone no wallet 

Day 1 i didnt really eat was to sick 
Day 2 i asked toast for breakfast with butter. what i got was bread with 2 frozen butter cubes and a knife. I skipped breakfast 
Lunch i skip as well 
Dinner i focused my self to eat mac and cheese thew it up. That could be becuase i was sick or the test was that bad. adding salt made it worst.
I was skipping meals even though i had no money or energy to get food and my friend and family didnt even know i was in hopital.

Day 3 start of the same. I ask for porridge got oat soup throw it up. Doctor are getting worried i am not eating. 3 in afternoon and i get fed up i ask for my injection of morphine after they give it i rip out my cannula 
Put on my clothes and walk all the way home. 20 min walk not bad if every step didnt feel like my last. Got home Order pizzer as i was waited i made myself some toast (was not hard even on morphine) had my food then took uber back to kings with my walet and phone. 

Dont go kings. 
If i didnt have sickcell i would never go.

title: Disappointed
body: I visited the GP yesterday and was disappointed to realise that I'd accidentally booked an appointment with the wrong Doctor (this was my fault, not the surgery's, as I had booked using the online tool). The Doctor I usually see is very kind & understanding, although can take a little while to get referrals through etc, but that's completely understandable being a busy GP. I'd always left feeling helped. However yesterday, I saw a different Doctor than my usual one and she was terrible. My worst fear, when going into the appointment, was that I'd be laughed out of the room, and that was pretty much what I got. The one thing I did request her to do, she tried to get out of and my partner, who had attended the appointment with me, had to beg her to do it. She couldn't have cared less about my problems, had a bad & unfriendly attitude and I left the surgery in tears, feeling worse than when I went in. I felt completely belittled. It was an appalling service in every sense of the word, and I'm not usually one to complain.

title: Terrible surgery
body: Joined surgery last September, and have had nothing but problems, my first appointment, a smear done by nurse who was not qualified so had to be redone several months later, every repeat prescription not passed to pharmacy next door, reception says its pharmacy's error and when you speak to the pharmacy they blame reception! Cannot get a appointment for three weeks and have now been trying for three days to get a emergency appointment with no luck. I'm on hold for a minimum 30mins from 8am for them to say no sorry all appointments gone call back at 12:30 which I have done, left on hold again for over 30mins to be told again no appointments. This is so frustrating as last month Doctor advised a new GP was joining surgery so would be easier to get a appointment so changed over to new doctor and can still not get a appointment for 3 weeks. Found out today the GP only works 3days????

title: Useless
body: Can't keep appointments get appointment and they just cancel it all the time absolutely waste of time and a absolute joke this hospital is. Now I refuse to ever go to this hospital....

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practise
body: Both the consultant and the shoe fitting department were very accomplished. All the staff were caring

readBy.name: Spire Healthcare

title: Great radiography dept shame about the…
body: Daughter had to attend an For an X-ray for diagnostic study. All the radiographers were fab, really went above and beyond. Unfortunately the same could not be said for the receptionist she was surly unhelpful and downright rude to many of the patients who had the misfortune to come across her! Patients given bags and gowns not told where the changing facilities were! She was snapping and snarling to another patient that had been misdirected to another dept and a man had to state if I could get the attention of this receptionist I would be able to book in ... it wasn’t busy! I know it’s Saturday But it was a routine appointment and it would be such a shame for one person to tarnish an otherwise fabulous service

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing Staff
body:
The receptionist was incredibly helpful in a very difficult time! She deserves all the praise she can get as she is always helpful and willing to advise and help as much as she can! The surgery should be proud to have her represent them
 Thank you !

title: wonderful experience
body: This has to be the best medical experience I have had. Pleasant staff clean quick and efficient and I would certainly recommend it to anyone. as a patient you are made at ease immediately

title: No further forward
body:
Recently , I hot called back for bloods and xrays.
After tests, I got told I had an infection in my knee.Told me I need iv antibotics . After 3 hours , I chased it up to be told doctor had written it wrong. So after 4 hours I finally get the antibotics ( scared and worried I shouldn't of waited 4 hours ) They stated your going on a ward ,for an operation to your knee with an infection .
The following day , I get told no operation and no infection.Speclist said , we will follow up with pain clinic and physio.
No one followed it up, so the following day very upset to tell the doctor nothing was followed up .
In an extra day , then an another 2 nights stayed in. I'm no further forward,  still limping in and still come out limping. Waiting on my discharge, I wish I had heard my specialist  state dont want to keep giving drugs, we need to get to the bottom if this ..My one is happy to abuse my body  my liver , to pre long a knee replacement.  Also this morning found out hospital hadnt been giving my other blood pressure tablets ..Lister failed miserably.

title: Good Health Event 9th January 2020
body:
This day event was extremely interesting, apart from the workshops many local support groups attended and proved very useful.
The follow up was very good and I look forward to the next event.
Wish it could have been more widely available,  prevention is better than cure!

title: Excellent service
body: Went to A&E on a Friday evening with my daughter who had broken her wrist . The waiting room was very busy so we were expecting a long wait . We were seen and assessed within a few minutes and were sent immediately to radiology and into a treatment area. Although we were there a long time , we were treated well and options and treatments explained clearly and with kindness at every stage.

readBy.name: Mid Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Can't say enough great things about the gp.
body:
Yesterday I was treated by a lovely doctor.
She is simply fantastic. Great smile, friendly, patient and super helpful with my questions. She takes always time to explain everything to me.
I want to thank her so much for the excellent care, attention, support and positive thinking. She makes my experience enjoyable.
Truly a wonderful doctor that deserves 10 stars.
Staff is awesome too. 
The receptionists are very friendly and always ready to help.

title: Blood Test Results
body:
Blood test at Northwood Health Centre after Christmas (Bad Timing)
Received phone call regarding result within a few days!   
The follow up care was efficient and another blood test scheduled for three months.

title: Ophthalmology Glaucoma Clinic: Thank you
body:
I attended the above clinic on 14 January.   I was given 2 appointments; 12.25 and 2pm.  I was seen punctuality at the first appointment  by friendly  and professional  staff, who observed  my second appointment  was at 2pm.  Staff alerted  the opthalmologist who generously managed to see me directly  after my Optometry tests, thus saving me a long wait between  appointments. 

The diagnosis  and advice I received  from him  was excellent,  identifying I did not have glaucoma,  my symptoms  were related to oxygen  therapy as a premature  baby.  I was given useful dietary  advice to keep my eyes healthy.

I would  recommend  this Clinic to anyone  who requires eye treatment. 

Kind regards

Mrs Norma  Collier

title: Great care lovely caring staff
body: Dri grove hospice care was amazing facilities very good and staff were brilliant very impressed with standard of care

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible service
body:
Appalling. I rang this morning to see if I could just walk in, having badly injured my back. I was told I could. I have driven here from Brixworth, only to be told by the extremely rude lady on reception, ‘this is not a walk in clinic, call your doctor on Monday.’ She did not even let me finish what I was saying. When I advised her I had phoned first, her response was, ‘that is not my problem, is it?’ Absolutely appalling. 

In addition, there is no opening hours on the website and when I phoned, I got through to the Berrywood Hospital! Ridiculous.

readBy.name: Northamptonshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant breast screening in Tesco car park!
body: Lovely receptionist, lovely radiologist, everything on time - and then - I got the results back from a Monday screening on the next Saturday morning through the post.  I don't know whether I've put this on the right review site, so I'm happy for you to forward this to the right place, or let me know what I can do to spread the word.

title: Dedication
body: Emergency appointment, thorough treatment & referral. When I left surgery was full of waiting patients, a few probably not as ill as those who wait for appointments, it was passed 6.30pm & Dr had clearly got a few hours to go to see them all. Sincere thanks for competence, diligence, sensitivity & excellent treatment.

title: Great Doctors Pathetic administration
body: The Doctors at this practice are excellent and do a fantastic job. However the administration side is a complete shambles. They are never able to answer simple questions, give false information out and are generally very unhelpful. This is such a shame given the hard work and dedication of the medical staff

title: Good use of pharmacist
body: As usual pharmacist was competent, enquiring & professional. She is a good listener, easy to talk to & very knowledgeable.

title: Great practice and great staff
body: We have been using this practise for many years and it is a superb medical surgery. Their new location is much more convenient to get to and a lot more modernised than the previous building. They always have plethora of appointments available in order to fit me in and I’ve always received my prescriptions very quickly. All the staff are also friendly and try to accommodate me when possible. I can’t really ask for much more from a GP surgery.

title: Wonderful care/ support
body: I can not thank the 2 Drs and the head nurse enough. For all the support care during my ill health over the last 8 years. Ensuring i got appointments at other NHS services when needed. have been amazing. Shame we can not put names. But you know who you are. Today im fit and healthy. And medication free. WE would be lost with out you. MICHELLE.

title: First class
body:
We have very recently changed to Siam Surgery and so glad we did. My husband has had two appointments since changing and he has been so impressed with both the GP and the Nurse he saw. The GP was very thorough and showed great concern with my husband’s problem and has already arranged xrays for him. The Nurse was very nice and polite, he was a bit nervous on the first visit after 40 odd years with the previous surgery, but the Nurse made him feel at ease and was very pleasant. I now await my two forthcoming appointments. 

I must mention that we were worried about our repeat prescriptions, whether they would be ready etc., but I rang the surgery a day before they were due and the receptionist kindly reassured me that these had already been sent to the relevant chemist which was a great relief, thank you.

title: Well Treated
body:
Arrived 8.45 for 9.00 appointment, called at 9.00, initial board reading examination,  informed of possible 5 procedures likely with slight delays between , next a field test, photograph back of eye, drops to enlarge pupil, seen by lady Doctor for thorough examination, advised of outcome ,further examination in 4 months. Very pleased with efficiency of all staff, discharged, 10.45am. No parking problems being unable to drive due to drops, took taxi there and back.
Thankyou, a happy patient

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Services
body: I like the way I am treated in my doctors surgery, everyone is very nice and I always get an appointment when I need one. Thank you to everyone for looking after me and my family.

title: Helpful staff
body:
Following a recent illness I have excellent care from the surgery from 
the nurse I saw first who immediately recognised my condition could have been serious and sent me for xray at hospital and arranged an appointment with a doctor who then prescribed tablets and a further hospital test. Thanks to everyone concerned as I am now a lot better.

title: Great care
body:
This was a routine booked appointment to see a GP
I was seen on time with no delays. The GP was kind, listened to me and treated me accordingly.

title: Informative Facebook Page
body:
Thank you for keeping your Facebook Page up to date about the Coronavirus!

I only just registered and am glad I can access medical Infomration from you, even on a Saturday.

title: excellent service
body: Arrived at walk in centre with elderly mother booked in and was seen within 10 minutes of arriving fantastic . given check over and pain relief advice everything explained in detail only went because 111 wait was 15 minutes just to speak to somebody.we were in and out in that time.Thank you we were very grateful for your help.

title: Endoscopy
body: I had an appointment at the refurbished Endoscopy unit on 20.1.2020.  The unit was spotlessly clean, the staff and nurses were lovely and professional, all put me at my ease and made sure I was comfortable.  The person who did the procedure was kind, and caring as were the 2nd endoscopist and trainee.  At my request I was given sedatives before the procedure, and during an uncomfortable part of it was given gas and air.  A small polyp was removed and I was left feeling at ease and comfortable.  After the procedure I was wheeled into a ward bay and my BP was taken every ten minutes for twenty minutes, after which I was given tea and biscuits.  I cannot fault the unit or staff, and would be very much at ease should I require another colonoscopy.  This appoint was a whole different experience from one I had in the same unrefurbished unit in 2011, when I was told they didn't do sedatives, the nurse doing the colonoscopy remarked why did she get all the hysterectomy patients, and that the steralizing unit had broken down the night before but not to worry as the scopes were steralizing in a bucket. I not only suffered humilation and pain but came away worrying I might have contracted some sort of disease from the scope.  A very unpleasant experience.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Such kindness
body: Cannot stress enough how much I appreciate the kindness of this department. You’re treated as an individual that they want to help and it’s never an inconvenience. Friendly receptionists, nurses who know your name instantly, a consultant who understands and a specialist nurse who listens and encourages. Perfect in every way. I’ve been diabetic for 44 years and it certainly wasn’t like this then! Thank you .

title: Excellent
body:
Excellent practice that has time for its patients - appointments are typically 15 minutes rather than the usual 10 mins. Had a health review recently that was informative and conducted in a pleasant unhurried fashion.
I am really pleased with our family membership. The practice is concerned with preventative measures and not just treating everything with medication. Easily available on phone. Humane practice.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Great Department
body:
Having had a  very bad experience of an endoscopy, in another hospital, I was very frightened when I arrived at Circle Bath.  I explained my fear to both the nurse and the consultant and they were extremely kind and understanding. From my arrival to the time I went in for my endoscopy all the staff that were involved in my treatment were amazing. It is difficult to convey in words how grateful I am to the whole team.  

I would recommend Circle Bath unreservedly.

title: Great care and communication
body:
My father has been treated with great care and respect during his three days at your hospital.  He was treated with respect during his time on SAU and 11b. He felt able to ask questions about his treatment and was grateful when staff took the time to explain things he was not sure about. At no point did he feel anxious or belittled as he has done in other hospitals.  
Many thanks for restoring my faith in the NHS as a caring institution

title: Awful practice
body: My friend got rushed into A and E after having a seizure got told by the doctor she must take this medication straight away to stop her from having another one. Gave the nurses my friends prescription and they sent it to pharmacy straight away 3 hours later still no medication, spoken to the nurses a couple of times who have chased the pharmacy up and still no luck. This is awful, the pharmacy has put my friend in server medical danger by not providing these medication to her. I will never becoming to this A and E ever again!

title: Uncaring
body:
Received a letter from the practice saying I would be being taken off there list, as I had moved out of the area, this arrived just two days after being referred to the Mental Health Crisis Team. 
My I take this opportunity to remind you of your LPT values : passion, respect, integrity and trust. Maybe you should remind yourselves of these values and put them into practice next time. Thank you for making me all the more anxious, by sending that letter when you did. Just a little bit of empathy was all that was needed. Sending the letter just a few weeks later may have made all the difference, but obviously no thought for the patients state of mind or health was taken into consideration. Patients are human beings, we have feelings and shouldn’t just be treated like a number on a spreadsheet.

readBy.name: NHS Leicester City CCG

title: 1st class
body: Visited surgery today, phoned in morning, yes had to wait but I think we all accept it is the same at all surgeries I have waited considerably longer at others! spoke to lovely lady who booked me in that day, GP was fab he is best GP I have seen, think more people should make time to say well done and thank you as we just seem to make time to complain. And so great to just park right outside and for free!

title: Admirable Consultant
body: On Thursday I had my last appointment at the HRT clinic. After treatment with the consultant who I found to be expert empathetic and very kind, I am happy to say that I have my life back and am back at work which is hard to belive when I go over the many issues I had before I was referred to the hospital. I cannot recommend the clinical team enough - thankyou

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: A very good service
body: I was seen on time and received excellent care and information. I could not find fault with any aspect of my visit.

title: Marvelous practice at Bolton
body: From the moment I went for my pre op, I felt confident everything was going to be ok. All the staff were friendly and efficient. When I went for the cataract operation itself they made me feel at ease even though I was nervous. The building itself is spotlessly clean inside and quite easy to find.

title: Excellent Staff
body: My mum had a cardiac arrest and from the A&E staff to all the people that helped her and the staff In ICU, amazing job. Very professional, caring staff.  They all do a wonderful Job and now my mum is on the mend from there help. Thank you

readBy.name: Dartford and Gravesham NHS Trust

title: Millview Visit
body: The visit was to collect a repeat prescription, so not too important but necessary nevertheless.  Having only requested it online the previous day, I was pleasantly surprised to get a text telling me it was ready to be collected.  The pick up was fine, no delays, but the only negative part was the parking.  This does need to be improved.

title: Not very good
body: I have been at shiphay manor surgery for over 35 years,it was the best in the bay,you could see doctor every day with out a problem all the staff where great and then it moved in to chelston hall , great (not) it has only 2 star rating I wonder why,try and get to see a GP ( good luck on that !!! )I gave up trying.l discovered a lump on my chest and it worried me so I rang the surgery hoping to see a GP,I was greeted by the must rudest receptionist I ever spoken to in my life I was told to ring 8  30 in the  morning to get in , after saying to her what is the chance of seeing a doctor she laughed and put the phone down on me ,that made me so angry I went down to the surgery,there they are (all reception staff standing around drink tea and talking ,no one on reception) .I got so fed up I changed doctor to another practice,I called my new surgery at 08.00 doctor called me at 08.15 and he saw me at 09.30 the same day ,that's what I call good service even the reception staff where the best I have ever seen in years ,

title: Very good practice in times of need!
body: I needed an emergency appointment on the 31st of January 2019, and the practice efficiently booked me in on the same day. I was seen by doctor and could not be any happier with the staff and service here. The level of care is great here and I feel better already! Thank you.

title: Very professional
body: Under rheumatology and just had an MRI. What could have been a stifling experience changed due to caring and attentive staff. I had full confidence in these radiographers. Also think the Rheumatologist I am under is exceptionally bright and sharp. Respect!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great birth experience
body: From the start of my pregnancy NMH Maternity were very supportive and all the staff were fantastic. As a first time mum with a history of mental health, the Magnolia team were exactly what I needed. They were so helpful, highly experienced, open, honest and supportive -I was able to text whenever I was worried about something and they would respond. The only time I was upset was after having a glucose test which was high and the doctors seemed to think I had gestational diabetes because scans were showing that my baby was bigger than average. Both of these proved to be false in the end and it was a shame to have been made to worry so much in the lead up to the birth. The midwife that was there with me for the birth of my son went above and beyond her duty - ordering lunch and not stopping for lunch break, working past her 12 hour shift on New Year's Eve of all days! After birth the midwives that came to visit gave excellent advise and helped to make my feel at ease with being a new mum.   I'm very lucky to have had their support.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Thank you
body:
I would like to say a massive thank you to all the staff who looked after my mum recently whilst she received care at your hospital. She was very apprehensive & anxious about having to come to a hospital that wasn't in her home city (Liverpool) but everyone she met whilst she was there were very professional and friendly & put her at ease. Special thanks go to Consultant & Urogynaecology Specialist Nurse - they have given my mum her health back & given her a new lease of life with their outstanding care and they are an asset to your hospital. Please pass on mine & my family's thanks to your wonderful staff.
Pam.

title: Gave up in the end
body: Spent a wasted 1hour 45 minutes at the BUCC. Went because when I contacted my GP practice the previous day, they informed me that the first appointment available was in 12 days time [another failing part of the Primary Care service of the NHS]. This was unacceptable as I was pretty certain that my problem was a recurrence of Shingles - with attendant pain and rashes. The prescription and used of anti-viral drugs/cream s is the normal treatment; but has to be started early on to be effective. Booked in and seen by the triage nurse. When I queried the receptionist [who had obviously missed the customer service course] after a 1.5 hour wait why several people who came after me were seeing the doctor first, I was told that this was up to the nurse and her decision on priority, I understand that but when 50% of those who arrived after you go ahead of you, the impression is that you do not matter. At that point I decided to leave as I was not prepared to wait until everyone else had been seen. The underlying problems are lack of training in triage, insufficient clinical staff numbers to deal with the patients presenting and poor management.

title: Wonderful Team
body: The Team in MIU were fabulous, really friendly and caring. I can't thank them enough for fixing me up in great time and really looking after me.

readBy.name: Gloucestershire Care Services NHS Trust

title: Thorough Diagnosis
body: From the volunteer who wheeled me from the reception area to A&E when I was taken unwell to the treating doctor and nurses who were very professional and caring I am extremely grateful. The doctor was thorough, professional and caring in his assessment and I felt very safe in his hands. A great and reassuring experience in a very unhappy situation.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust
NHS Leicester City CCG

title: Great experience
body: Easy to find and even better was the fact you didn’t pay for parking. Was seen on time and the staff were very professional.

title: Understanding GP
body:
I have a very busy work life and the surgery ensures that it accommodates my work with appointments. I get to see the same GP and therefore get consistency. 

Also my parents first language is not English and they feel comfortable with the staff and doctors and I do not need to take time out of my work as there is no language barrier

title: Excellent hospital
body:
Would highly recommend this hospital, staff and especially the consultant are all amazing.
Felt in extremely good hands, the consultant is very personable, I feel privileged to have had him perform my surgery, he’s top class.

title: Excellent practice
body: I'm always to get an appointment when needed and have always received excellent care and prompt referral if necessary. Prescription requests are often available for collection the same or next day.

title: Excellent A+E care
body: Spent most of afternoon in A+E with my 91yr father. Excellent care, tests carried out in good time. A big thanks to the doctor,  nurse and must especially mention the duty social worker, who was fantastic.

title: Awful service
body:
I came to make an appointment and was told after a long que wait that none for 3 weeks as the doctors apparently work across 3 places and only nurse appointment.Finally Made one . The doctor was late. Further the doctor kept talking on the phone to someone else whilst I was waiting to be checked out.i asked to explain about my recent hospital admission from the hospital letter but was told they had lost it .
I lost any faith with these doctors and moving out soon to the neighbouring practice .This place is going downhill .

title: MRI private patient.
body: I think the department for an MRI would be under radiology but that isn’t on your list so I had to select, “don’t know”, which makes me look rather stupid. I paid almost £500 to go as a private patient yet ended up waiting over an hour for my MRI along with about ten other NHS patients, I think I was the last to go in. Afterwards I was told it would take 3-4 weeks for the results. How do you think I should feel about this?

readBy.name: Croydon Health Services NHS Trust

title: Amazing staff through traumatic experience
body: The staff on both labour ward and ward A2 were brilliant during my birth experience. Whilst the staff are clearly very busy, they were still very caring and attentive. When my labour took a turn for the worse, all the staff from midwives to theater staff were amazing. They saved my little girls life & ill be forever greatful for that. I was brilliantly looked after, after my category 1 emergency c-section in recovery and back on the ward. Huge huge thank you again

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unsatisfied
body: Attended medocc over 3 times in a week due to my bowels playing up I felt like I was dying. Bought in by ambulance sent straight to medocc. There was 5 other people there was told 2 and a half hours wait I ended up waiting 4-5 hours because they only had one doctor. I was then seen to and the doctor I saw was extremely rude was not listening to my problems what so ever just wanted to see me then chuck me out comments like ‘get on the bed’ aggressively and being very heavy handed with me. I actually was in tears when I left will be making a formal complaint.

readBy.name: Medway Community Healthcare
NHS Medway CCG

title: Fantastic care
body: Thank you for the excellent service,I received while on wads 27 and ESA,the surgeon and all the excellent nursing team,they are a credit to your hospital,nothing was to much trouble to any of them ,

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: SEAU-SAL -Anesthetist and surgeons
body: After my recent visit i am not one to make a big fuss as i know all staff are in a great deal of pressure ,I would like to thanks all staff in all departments for the care i received ,you work miracles for your patients even when over stretched and under staffed  .Thank You

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great ward and staff. Ward 33.
body:
I was admitted to hospital with severe stomach pain. After a few scans it was discovered that I had a twisted / blocked l bowel.
I spent 14 days in ward 33. Every member off staff on the ward were fantastic. From the tea maker to the sister, they couldn't do enough for you. Whether it was sneaking you an extra biscuit or making sure I wasn't in pain. I cannot thank them enough. Everyone was brilliant. 
I also need to thank the surgeons. They did not dive in to operating on me . They tried various options first so I wouldn't need to go under the knife. Which luckily eventually work. So thank you everyone! Your all brilliant.

Love Andrew Pearson

readBy.name: Mid Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Terrible practise
body: Terrible service, depends which doctor you see,, its pot luck,, i was given codeine for a sore area, I have epilepsy and found out that it's not compatible with other med I'm on,?,, I've also suffered with a blocked nose for years, I've tried every medication nothing works, fed up going to practise and not believed about my condition, re blocked nose I reserched it myself and found a remedy with the help of my pharmacist,, the blocked nose as caused me to cough, post nasal drip the pharmacy called it, since taking the pharmacy's advice the cough as stopped, and my nose is so much better, and I can sleep at night,

title: Shocked and disappointed.
body: Visited this department with my 15 year old son I was later reported to social services because my son hugged and kissed myself. I  was told that this was inappropriate behaviour. No further action was taken as I am a Great mother. Needless to say shocked and disappointed.

readBy.name: Lewisham and Greenwich NHS Trust

title: Disappointed
body:
I’ve long given up on this GP’s surgery after having to put up with the receptionists.
A good while back called for an appointment & was told there was non available & to call back tomorrow at 08:30 only to get though the next day to be told the same thing. So the next day I went down to the surgery where I was told, not informed that I have to call them to get an appointment “really what ever happened to patient care“. Anyway I gave up & have in about five years of being registered here I’ve only ever managed to see an actual doctor once in this time.

Only last week I was horrified when my partner asked me to go collect a perception, not a problem until I got there & noticed the glass at the reception desk was covered in all sorts of dried spit & saliva that looked like it had built up over a long time. I mentioned it to the receptionist who just joked it off with a comment to the security guard sitting at the other end of the counter (I didn’t catch what was said but they both laughed it off). We are already worried about what we can catch but to be presented with  this at a health centre really isn’t good.

title: Great Surgery, great care
body: Unfortunately between myself and my two sons, we use  Surgery frequently. My overall experience with this practice is great. Staff are always very positive and recently seen a new male GP at the surgery and he was very caring. Practice Nurse prescriber who looks after my son for his Asthma also very good and knowledgeable. Easy to make appointment and can actually see same GP if requested.  Cant fault this practice.

title: Very thorough medical professionals
body: I have been very impressed by the doctors' comprehensive care of my complicated medical needs over the last year. Quick to make appropriate referrals to hospital services and to follow up the outcomes.

title: Wonderful service and care
body: My husband had an angiogram on 31 Jan and in the procedure they found that he needed a stent. All the team in this unit were fantastic and they also managed to insert the stent that afternoon rather than returning on Monday. We cannot give enough praise to all the team there and also to the team in CCU. Outstanding service and care throughout. The NHS gets a lot of flack but these front line staff are the glue that holds it all together. Thank you all so very, very much.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital
